rComments: The worst professor I ever had. I ended up doing decent in the class but she was so unclear on every assignment, extremely rude, and didnt care about her students. Dont take this class unless you have mind reading capabilities. Going to her lectures felt like a waste of time because I had to reteach myself everything anyways. So awful

This class was definitely tough, with a harsh grading style. However, the final grade scale was very lenient, an 80-90 was an A-. This class will be alot easier making some good friends to work with, as most things you can work together on. I did learn alot . She is also very kind and helpful in office hours, so go there for help.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Graded by few things', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Marzieh single handedly made me change majors because of how difficult she made an Introduction to Programming course. The lectures did not help nearly as much as YouTube. Labs were far more helpful because of the TAs, but most of the "projects" were on material that was self taught. Trying to learn a new language through broken English never works

Poor grammar on instructions, uploads errors on major assignments. Lectures are supplementary at best, have done most of my learning from stackoverflow. Strays from the coursework of other university profs in favor of more tedious work. Very harsh grading isn't balanced by a more lenient grade scale.

Be kind to yourself and don't sign up for this prof. Lectures are taken straight from w3schools and made worse. They provide very little value and are wildly disorganized. Reaching out to her online is a pain also. Her responses are wildly inconsistent and tend to be pretty rude. Avoid her classes and use w3schools instead.

way too many weekly assignments, feels like you never get a break. she is very rude and is not helpful when you ask questions. I changed my major because of her awful teaching- I just do not enjoy comp sci anymore.
her grading scale is lenient(80 - 90 is A- and 90 - 100 is A), but her way of teaching makes it extremely hard for beginners to understand.

If you are even considering majoring in CS, you have to stay away from Professor Amadzadeh. She does not know the definition of intro level course. Her assignments are on stuff we havent even learned. Trying to understand what she wants you to do is like learning a new language. She just expects everyone to know Java and she lowkey stupid.

She hands out "tokens" to encourage class participation. It's a beginners class, but non beginners can't seem to understand that she restricts methods we can use in the assignments to make it fair to everyone (I appreciate this, b/c I'm a beginner). If you pay attention and read, and ask questions, you'll be fine although it is tough. She is fair.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Sucks

I highly RECOMMEND AGAINST anyone taking her classes after my current ongoing experience. Her broken English makes the class much harder than it should be, especially on tests. She's terrible with feedback on work and has somehow made a beginner course unfriendly to beginners. Seems like a nice person, but her teaching skills can be vastly improved

Please don't take her if you're just a pure-hearted beginner like I was. The class is just for super nerds who have been coding since they were 5 years old and love thinking about code all damn day. I'm a nerd but just no. Save yourself the trouble. Take it somewhere else. I'm switching majors but if you love CS, take 1301 and 1302 elsewhere.
Constant spelling/grammar mistakes + rude responses to anyone who has questions leads to the worst experience I have ever had in a classroom. Avoid or don't take the class if you value your sanity

She is one of the worst professors I have had for several reasons. The assignments cover extremely difficult content that she has either only briefly mentioned, or hasn't mentioned at all, and on top of that, the instructions to go along with the assignments are sometimes too vague for comprehension, littered with mistakes. Grading is arbitrary.
One of the worst professor .
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: I am in UGA CSCI 1301 - Grading goes 0, .5 , 1.0 on weekly exercises and assignments - Piazza used in the CS department, she responds with "Maybe if you came to lecture you would know" "DO NOT EMAIL ME ANYMORE" - Came in with 4 years of Java experience from robotics in HS am failed for having prior knowledge and experience with programming.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. I genuinely think that if you are a beginner you would do better in comp sci 2. She gives out three grades:0,50,100, and say goodbye to 100's. Even if your code works as desired, she will find a problem with it. Her test's don't test you knowledge, but rather your ability to give the answer she wants.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Her grading scale is not synonymous with the university's scale. Her grading scale is 0, 50, and 100. No inbetween, except for on tests. Disrespectful to students in her snide remarks. She makes it obvious that this is a weed-out class. Will not answer her student's questions about assignments, will only answer questions on exercises. Only 2 tests.

For an intro class, she makes it unnecessarily difficult. Her weekly exercises are too hard for students with no prior experience. She is disrespectful and does not answer questions clearly. Makes snarky comments constantly, and is unable to properly help when approached by a student. Would NOT recommend this class even to people with experience...
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: You are not allowed to use what you have not learned yet, which makes the assingments difficult. On exercises, you can only receive grade of 0, 50, or 100.
She emphasizes its an intro course yet youll find yourself doing things common in Java II by your midterm, currently trying to withdraw so have fun :)

I really wish I had listened to the reviews before signing up for her class. I didnt know professors could be as terrible & uncaring of their students as her. It has gotten so bad with her teaching at the University Of Georgia, i have thought of going to the department head. She is vague with instructions and grades like she wants people to fail

If you have no prior experience you will not do well unless you get a tutor or make friends with experience. Doesn't respond to email, tells you to use Piazza but just leaved rude comments and takes off points if you ask questions, so plan to teach this class to yourself.

All of her exercises and tests are graded by a made-up rubric and she doesn't tell any of her students how to do the problems if they get them wrong. She just becomes very snarky with everyone and says figure it out. She somehow always finds something wrong in a student's code or test. I wouldn't take this class with her again.

Would prefer to spend her time making snarky remarks on piazza rather than take the time to help students understand what they are doing wrong. The actual content we learn is not particularly difficult, but points will still get taken off assignments due to arbitrary restrictions she places on them that aren't in the rubric. Avoid at all costs.
Awful

Consistent English mistakes, which tend to get exponentially magnified by the fact that almost every assignment has some stipulation that isn't in the instructions, and this stipulation isn't brought to our attention until she sarcastically responds to someone on Piazza. It's effected my grade a fair amount despite having decent coding experience.

Genuinely one of the worst professors I have taken. We use an online platform called Piaaza for asking questions and her responses to the questions are rude and she tells you to look at the description of the exercises more carefully as things are "explicity" stated instead of trying to help and answer the questions.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Test heavy', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Marzieh mostly relied on F. Estrada to create assignments and never handled the grading herself. Although she is a kind person, her poor English and grammar made lectures more of a mind-numbing experience than a learning one. Her lectures often seemed like a subpar representation of the weekly notes posted.

She needs to improve her English, most of us felt that it was very difficult to understand her questions in the assigned homework and tests. Over 60% of students dropped the course after the midterm. She is better going back her home country to use her first language to teaching the C.S.

If you understand English, then the work in this course will probably frustrate you. As others mentioned, her assignments are purposefully vague. This, in addition to English not being her first language, leads to her assignments having statements that mean something other than what she intends, leading to you getting the "wrong" answer.

Wrote 5000 lines of Java for the final project, less than 1% of the code was actually related to databases. She adds new assignments requirements on Piazza and expects everyone to have read it. Assignments are not well thought out, lots of mistakes and missing pieces. Would not recommend, take the course downtown instead.

Awful, reads lectures off the slides, doesn't really know whats shes talking about. unwilling to regrade work just because she rather not. would not recommend her ability to teach. thankfully the nature of the course allows you to self learn online and is not extremely tough

She really doesn't care about her students and what she taught. She makes the assignments and exam 'hard' by giving too vague requirements. She does not reply to your questions on those until the very end of the deadline or just doesn't reply to you at all. She closed piazza before the end of the semester so we can not ask her any more questions.

Like others mentioned, the course material is fairly easy but her exercises and assignments can be so ambiguous and vague, making it hard to get full marks on. Her excuse was "it's always vague in the real world". She responds late to posts on piazza and totally forgot to post any past papers for the midterm. Her lectures are tedious and boring.
Prepared professor But fails to express what she wants in her questions. Class name on below is cscc43

Course is easy but homework is misleading. Answers don't make sense. Solutions contradict course materials and industry standards. Nobody shows up after midterm. Her English is terrible and can't ask questions properly therefore her course is a guessing game as a result. You won't succeed here because her questions are setting you up for failure.

The course material is easy, but do you know why I rated this 5 in terms of difficulty? It's because her instructions for assignments are constantly ambiguous, and will occasionally change when students point out contradictions. I don't have trouble with the course material, but I do have trouble understanding what she exactly she wants me to do.

She redeemed herself from the CSCA08 fall 2017 invreted lectures which she taught. Her lectures were clear and structured, and would try to engage the class just enough so that is wasn't annoying or frustrating. Assignments were fair, term test 2 was a bummer (as usual), and the brutal final got a THICC curve. Would definitely take again.

I had a pretty negative perspective of Marzieh from CSCA08, but from the first day we started to learn things in CSCA48, I actually got really engaged by the way she taught. She was passionate, & I always felt comfortable asking her questions after lecture or during the break. Sure the course was hard, but I'm glad she helped to make it easier.

Despite the criticism, her lectures are actually organized. She goes through the concepts and their definitions at the beginning of class then shows you the practicalities of it at the end. Better than profs who teach out of the blue with no clear organization in their lectures.

She is very knowledgable and it is very obvious that she knows her stuff. The lectures are structured in such a way that she teaches you the concepts first and then she shows you how to implement the concept. I prefer her lectures and her slides to those of *other* instructor's. Show up to class, take notes and there is not way you will do bad.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Clear grading criteria', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: clear if you pay attention in lectures

I don't even know where to start. She is not caring of her students at all. The passage on her assignments are projects are horribly confusing, not to mention the poor grammar and word choices and everything is just so bad I am just furious right now. Her material is easy, but she makes it hard to enjoying learning it.

I give this professor 1 point out of 5 only because because the system doesn't allow me to give her zero. She is an extremely soft speaker, you will have trouble to hear her in the back of the lecture hall. She wants students to ask her questions but she doesn't use piazza. Everybody knows the discussion board on BB is awful except for her!
Very unorganized course, projects weren't spread out and 2 projects were squeezed into the last week of the course.
Super boring lectures, unorganized course structure. Hard to reach.
